data.text: Dizzy Gillespie helped turn jazz from entertainment into a serious art form and used his international tours as cultural diplomacy during the Cold War to promote American culture and foster goodwill. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/FwPsziuBin

Illicit Chinese e-cigarettes are flooding our country - putting kids, communities, and our national security at risk. I joined my Senate Republican colleagues urging Treasury and USTR to crack down on this growing threat. https://t.co/j0kSBWkspg
Big thanks to Senator @JimJustice_WV for brightening our day with @BabydogJustice and sharing how she got her name. My wife is a huge fan! https://t.co/2rnf0NQWDA

Across South Carolina, families are feeling the effects of rising costs in everyday life. That’s why @POTUS is laser focused on affordability in 2026.

I’m determined to get my ROAD to Housing Act to the President’s desk and make housing more affordable. https://t.co/Hrzv4BCy2l
Blessed to be at the National Prayer Breakfast with my wife this morning. She’s the true prayer warrior of our family! https://t.co/QLqxtjUUYN

Great to hear from President Keith Faulkner of my alma mater, Charleston Southern University, about creating more pathways to opportunity for South Carolina students. Education rooted in faith and purpose changes lives! https://t.co/ipdUjMLwK9

Mary McLeod Bethune represented the NAACP at the UN founding conference as the sole woman of color among the U.S. delegation. She fought for women and people of color, leading to the establishment of an international bill of rights. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/QK7b1U8Uzc
